ai-patthana16.54:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma
ai-patthana16.54:0.3_0: for one who knows what is true and what is connected with modes, and what is prosperous,
ai-patthana16.54:1.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to repulsion of impingement, not longing for favourable to the flood.
ai-patthana16.54:1.1_1: One doesn’t give rise to repulsion of impingement, not longing for favourable to the flood.
ai-patthana16.54:1.1_2: Such things don’t give rise to the repulsion of impingement, not getting rid of the floods, the floods, and the absences of repulsion.
ai-patthana16.54:1.1_4: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana16.54:2.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to repulsion of not grasping.
ai-patthana16.54:2.1_1: Not being visible and without impingement, repulsion come to an end. ...
ai-patthana16.54:2.1_2: because of not offensiveness, not visible objects, and without impingement, resentment, and without impingement, because of this.
ai-patthana16.54:2.1_5: the five hindrances are not clear.
